break up.translation[0].definitions[0].d: if something breaks up, or if you break it up, it breaks into a lot of small pieces
break up.translation[0].definitions[0].e: It seems that the plane just broke up in the air.
Use a fork to break up the soil.
break up.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to separate something into several smaller parts
break up.translation[0].definitions[1].e: There are plans to break the company up into several smaller independent companies.
You need a few trees and bushes to break up the lawn.
break up.translation[0].definitions[2].e: Three policemen were needed to break up the fight.
break up.translation[0].definitions[3].d: to make people leave a place where they have been meeting or protesting
break up.translation[0].definitions[3].e: Government soldiers broke up the demonstration.
Police moved in to break up the meeting.
break up.translation[0].definitions[4].d: if a marriage, group of people, or relationship breaks up, the people in it separate and do not live or work together anymore
break up.translation[0].definitions[4].e: He lost his job and his marriage broke up.
The couple broke up last year.
Many bands break up because of personality clashes between the musicians.
Has Sam really broken up with Lucy?
break up.translation[0].definitions[5].d: if a meeting or party breaks up, people start to leave
break up.translation[0].definitions[5].e: The party didn’t break up until after midnight.
The meeting broke up without any agreement.
break up.translation[0].definitions[6].d: when a school breaks up, it closes for a holiday
break up.translation[0].definitions[6].e: When do you break up for Easter?
break up.translation[0].definitions[7].d: to make someone laugh by saying or doing something funny
break up.translation[1].definitions[0].d: if a company or group breaks up or is broken up, it is divided into smaller companies
break up.translation[1].definitions[0].e: The new chairman plans to break up the group into more autonomous subsidiaries.
break up.translation[1].definitions[1].d: if someone breaks up an arrangement or agreement, or if it is broken up, it ends
break up.translation[1].definitions[1].e: Japan’s Fair Trade Commission ordered 13 ink makers to break up a price-fixing cartel.
break up.translation[2].definitions[0].d: an occasion when a company or group is broken up into smaller units
break up.translation[2].definitions[0].e: Break-ups create added tax, interest and management costs.
